title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description:
An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected. Currently, when a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'defaultValue' field (e.g. '55/66/9999'), the invalid value is accepted and stored in the report design. This is problematic for two reasons.

Firstly, the model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss) to ensure portability. Currently, it is not doing so.

Secondly, the system should reject invalid date/time values to maintain data integrity and prevent unexpected behavior in the report.
OB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'defaultValue' field (e.g. '55/66/9999'), the invalid value is accepted and stored in the report design. The following definition shows up in the report design:<parameters><scalarparameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>
EB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'defaultValue' field (e.g. '55/66/9999'), the system should reject the invalid value and display an error message to the user. The invalid value should not be accepted and stored in the report design.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'defaultValue' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Press Enter or click outside the field.
5. Observe if the system rejects the invalid date value and displays an error message to the user.
